DOC.brief_summary: This double blind randomize control prospective clinical trial compare clinical success two tooth color resin composite dental filling material - TPH3 ( Dentsply Caulk ) experimental urethane dimethacrylate resin base composite resin ( Dentsply Caulk ) wear resistance , stain marginal seal use modify Ryge criterion evaluate posterior restoration 24 month duration
DOC.brief_title: Evaluate Effectiveness Experimental Urethane Dimethacrylate Resin Based Dental Composite Material
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose clinical trial evaluate two composite resin use restore Class I Class II cavity teeth adult . The clinical study evaluate resin composite restoration place Class I Class II cavity preparation anatomic form , color match , marginal integrity , marginal discoloration , proximal contact , polishability , caries , sensitivity , gingival index , stain , wear , thermal response 24 months..
DOC.criteria: â€¢ must give write consent participate trial must need least two restoration natural tooth replacement restoration without caries acceptable must available require postoperative followup visit restoration bicuspid , 1st 2nd molar restoration contact oppose natural crown teeth class II restoration must least one proximal contact restoration must buccal lingual/palatal width equal great 1/3 distance buccal lingual/palatal cusp tip 75 % restoration must Class II restoration must least one occlusal contact habitual closure severe medical complication ( organ transplant , long term antibiotic steroid treatment , cancer immunocompromised ) disability may able tolerate time required complete restoration provide adequate oral hygiene xerostomia either take medication know produce xerostomia radiation induce Sjogren 's syndrome patient chronic periodontitis , rampant caries poor oral hygiene may require extraction teeth restore history chronic bruxism unavailable long term recall tolerate rubber dam require tooth isolation preparation restoration . meet inclusion criterion present systemic local disorder contraindicate dental procedure include study unstable occlusion severe bruxing clench need TMJ relate therapy teeth periapical pathology expect pulp exposure teeth nonvital exhibit sign pulpal pathology Pregnancy Known sensitivity methacrylates and/or acrylate
